intro: Phacelia arizonica, commonly known as Arizona bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of hairy, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss. Arizona bluecurls play an important role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies in its native habitat.
